lines.text: How is Uncas?
Bad. Got squaw fever.
Major, I'll bet that's the best shot you ever made in all your life.
You see, a British officer never gives in without a struggle.
Spoken like a true Britain, sir!
And Miss Munro, you may consider yourself in a permanent state of siege.
I shall welcome it.
Howdy, Hawkeye! I haven't seen you in a coon's age.
Magua? I wonder what that weasel's doing here?
Him scout for Yank-gees. Mohawks take him in tribe - make him blood brother.
Mohawk? He was born a Huron. I bet a rifle against a powder horn he's still a Huron.
If you don't mind sir, I'd like to accompany the young ladies.
Well, that's one way to enjoy a war.
Injuns!
My people.
Oh? Well, what do they want?
Want pale-faced squaws.
Magua great warrior. Big White Chief Munro whip Magua like dog.
And you deserved it!
Now Magua wipe out scars. Pale-faced squaws live. You die.
Scalps to the Indians, Major, are like your medals and gotten by the same means. Killing.

[Hears howling in the distance]
What's that? Wolves?
On two legs and headed this way. Follow me.
I wonder if he can be trusted?
What makes you think he can't?
Well, after all, he's little more than a white savage himself.
Oh, Duncan, don't be such a bear.
I keep thinking there's an Indian behind every tree. My scalp feels very uncertain.
I wonder if you can understand, what it means to be first.
I think I can.
Fool! Separating our parties like this.
Two party alive. Good. One party dead. No good.
What on earth are you doing?
Listen to beaver. Downstream. Indian sentry. When canoe come, beaver flap tail.
Mohican? Are you taking us to your people?
All my people gone. Killed in Huron war. Once many warrior in tribe. For many summer, this our hunting ground. Now, only Chingachgook and Uncas left.
You're all alone.
Major, any reward I got coming from you - I can do without.
Pale-faced squaw. No good. Mohican. Fair hair make heart of Uncas weak like water.
It seems you have a healthy contempt for everything British, haven't you?
I haven't noticed the British busting any cheers whenever they see me.

Great Spirit. Fair warrior goes to you. Swift, straight and unseen like arrow shot into sun. Let him sit at Counsel fire of my tribe. For he is Uncas, my son. My fire, his ashes. Your fire, is bright. Now, all my tribe is there, but one. I, Chingachgook, Last of Mohican.
